newsitem.title: GERMANY: Hochtief 96 net profit up 6.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Hochtief 96 net profit up 6.8 pct.

text.p: German construction group Hochtief AG said on Tuesday 1996 net profit rose 6.8 percent to 146.1 million marks as restructuring costs were offset by one-off gains from the sale of certain subsidiaries.
The company also said orders in the first quarter of 1997 rose 37.6 percent to 3.2 billion marks, while output in the period rose 7.8 percent to 2.6 billion marks.
"We have reduced our subsidiary network and at the same time drawn together the know-how of the company into centres of competence," said chief executive Hans-Peter Keitel at a news conference.
Hochtief also said its worldwide payroll rose 1.1 percent ot 40,785, although it cut its doemestic workforce by 10.5 percent, or 2,300 jobs.
The costs of the job reductions were offset by the sale of units such as its Dames & Moore engineering unit in the United States, Keitel said.
While group net profit rose in 1996, parent company net profit was unchanged at 12.5 million marks. Parent pretax profits for 1996 were down 10.5 percent at 96.5 million marks.
